DevOps and R

Implementing an Entire R Development Life Cycle at Statistics Austria

Gregor de Cillia

Source: vignettes/devops.Rmd
devops.Rmd

Outline

  • Goal: outlining the conceptual framework we have implemented at Statistics Austia for
    • automatic checking and building of R packages
    • deployment of those packages
  • Our environment consists of
    • R Server (Rstudio-Server-Pro, Ubuntu)
    • Git-Server (BitBucket)
    • Build-Server (Jenkins)
  • For deployments, additionaly
    • Artifact repository manager (JFrog Artifactory) to collect sucessfully built R packages
    • Webserver (Ubuntu) to host HTML documentation

“Manual” Workflow

Setting up a new package that uses the build server requires to create

  • an RStudio project of type package on R server
  • a repository on BitBucket
  • a Jenkins Job on the build server

Additionaly,

  • those resources need to be connected
    • requires a post webhook token and a ssh keypair
  • jenkins job needs to be configured to check/build/deploy the package

This is quite tedious and leads to

  • inconsistent package design
  • inconsistent package tests

Workflow package

The new workflow makes it possible to set up resources on all three servers from the R server.

## useSTAT: inspired by www.github.com/r-lib/usethis
library(useSTAT)
## create a new project (package) from an internal template
create_stat_package("~/newPackage")
## set up version control
use_statbucket()
## create a new job on the build server
use_jenkins()

From now on every git push from the R project will trigger a build on jenkins.

In order to set up deployments, the file config/jenkins.yaml can be modified.

Pros and Cons

  • Pros
    • Easier for the users to set up new packages
    • More consistent package design
    • Consistent checking across internal packages
  • Cons
    • API keys are required to remotely create repos/jobs
    • Updating buildSTAT and yaml options is tedious to test because all tests need to run on build server (docker)

Thank you for your attention
